alert.note: Alert for South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 27 at 2:13PM PST until further notice by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Medford OR has issued a Flood Watch for the following river in Oregon... Coquille River at Coquille affecting the South Central Oregon Coast. .Recent heavy rainfall on top of lower and mid elevation snow pack has led to the potential for river flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Coquille River at Coquille. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, The Coquille River is at flood stage. Expect flooding of farmland and low-lying areas throughout the flood plain along the Coquille River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 16.2 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening around 1015 PM PST.
